items.title: Which insurance players will be impacted most and least by GST exemptions?

items.title: GST reset fuels demand hopes: M&M, Maruti, Hero Moto, Escorts, Ashok Leyland among beneficiaries
items.description: India’s auto industry is gearing up for an early festive boost after the GST Council rolled out sweeping tax cuts on small cars, SUVs, two-wheelers, tractors, and commercial vehicles. Analysts expect the move to trigger a 5 to 10 percent surge in demand and reset growth expectations across the sector

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description:
Gold held near an all-time high after a seven-day rally, as weak US data spurred more bets on an
interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month and mounting concerns over the central bank’s independence underpinned haven demand.

items.title: Markets likely to react positively to GST booster dose for FMCG, auto, insurance, consumer durables and MSMEs, say experts
items.description: Experts say that the decision of merging GST rates into 5% and 18% -- while reserving 40% for sin goods -- will benefit many sectors like FMCG, auto, insurance, consumer durables and MSMEs among others ahead of the festive season.
